intro: Meiota campechana, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many climbing vines. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found growing along riverbanks and in disturbed soils. Meiota campechana is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
